fu.util

Class StringUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • fu.util.StringUtil

  • public class StringUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Some utilities concerning string processing. (Originally from the DreamTeam-package).
    Version:
    2.02
    Author:
    Jörg Roth (Joerg.Roth@Fernuni-hagen.de)

      • indexOf

        public static int indexOf(java.lang.String key,
          java.lang.String[] list)
        Checks if a key is inside an array of strings. If yes, the index of the first occurence is returned, otherwise -1.

      • indexOfIgnoreCase

        public static int indexOfIgnoreCase(java.lang.String key,
                    java.lang.String[] list)
        Checks if a key is inside an array of strings - ignoring case. If yes, the index of the first occurence is returned, otherwise -1.

      • hasDuplicates

        public static int hasDuplicates(java.lang.String[] list)
        Checks if the list contains the same value twice. If yes, the index of the first occurence is returned. -1, if no duplate exits.

      • hasDuplicatesIgnoreCase

        public static int hasDuplicatesIgnoreCase(java.lang.String[] list)
        Checks if the list contains the same value twice (ignoring case). If yes, the index of the first occurence is returned. -1, if no duplate exits.

      • convertStr2XML

        public static java.lang.String convertStr2XML(java.lang.String text)
        Converts a text to a string that can appear inside an XML file. This e.g., means, "&" is replaced by "&".

      • convertXML2Str

        public static java.lang.String convertXML2Str(java.lang.String text)
        Converts a string that can appear inside an XML file a text to tradional string. This e.g., means, "&" is replaced by "&".

      • replaceChars

        public static java.lang.String replaceChars(java.lang.String what,
                            char toWhat,
                            java.lang.String text)
        Changes all characters of a string to another character. E.g. ("abcd",'x',"abcdefg")->"xxxxefg"
        Parameters:
        what - all characters to replace
        toWhat - the new character
        text - the text
        Returns:
        modified text

      • formatV

        public static java.lang.String formatV(java.lang.String str,
                       java.util.Vector<java.lang.Object> vars)
        Formats a vector of objects. The format string can contain the following elements:
        • ##; generates a #
        • #s; adds the next vector element
        • #snnn; adds the element, filled left to the specific number
        • #Snnn; adds the element, filled right to the specific number
        • #0nnn; fills left with 0 (only Integer)
        Parameters:
        str - format string
        vars - the element vector
        Returns:
        the formatted string

      • rawIPstr

        public static java.lang.String rawIPstr(java.net.InetAddress ip)

      • nthIndexOf

        public static int nthIndexOf(java.lang.String text,
             java.lang.String searchStr,
             int n)
        Return the index of the n-th occurence of searchStr within text. Returns -1 if the number of occurences is less than n.

      • stripTrailing

        public static java.lang.String stripTrailing(java.lang.String text,
                             java.lang.String trailor)
        Deletes a trailing string if it occurs, otherwise returns the original string, e.g., stripTrailing("hello","lo") -> "hel", stripTrailing("hello","la") -> "hello"

      • stripLeading

        public static java.lang.String stripLeading(java.lang.String text,
                            java.lang.String header)
        Deletes a leading string if it occurs, otherwise returns the original string, e.g., stripLeading("hello","he") -> "llo", stripLeading("hello","ha") -> "hello"

      • getLevenshteinDistance

        public static int getLevenshteinDistance(java.lang.String s,
                         java.lang.String t)
        Computes the Levenshtein between two Strings. Informally, the Levenshtein distance between two words is the minimum number of single-character edits (insertion, deletion, substitution) required to change one word into the other.
